Councell.
May it please yo
r
good LL. That w
ch
I had in
charge, by yo
r

re
of
e 7 of this moneth,
for
e company of
S
r
John Poley
, to be sent to
Ostende
,
I have proposed to this
Councel
, who also desire it
very earnestly themselves. But
e companie being
nowe at
e siege of
Gertrudenbergh
, they make it
a mater prejudicial to
e Contrey, to w
t
drawe them
on
e soddaine, while they are in actual service.
And though they of themselves should be willing
therunto, yet
ei knowe
at
Co. Maurice
will stay
them for
e time. For having taken
e Fort before
Gertrudenbergh, w
ch
is thought will occasion the
losse of
e towne, it is nowe
at
e Enemie must
attempt their reliefe, and
at
e states much con-
tinue their forces together. They doe promise not-
w
t
standing,
at w
t
e first opportunitie, when this
action is perfourmed, or before, if it may be, and
as they finde it in reason for
e contreis greatest
benefit, they will send away
e horseband. Wherof
I will not faile, to put them in remembrance,
and so I have advertised
e
Gouverno
r
of Ostende

letter
s
,
for
at there are no Deputies, to fournishe an as-
semblie, nor no appearance of any to meete a
long time. In w
ch
respect I have advised the
messenger
at brought it
to repaire againe home, for
e avoiding
of charges. And as touching his suite, I will doe
in time convenient, what is possible for me, and
